title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #88: Induced Subgraphs in Ramsey Graphs**

The Erdős-McKay Conjecture: For ε-Ramsey graphs, induced subgraphs achieve all edge counts up to δn².

**Answer**: PROVED by Kwan-Sah-Sauermann-Sawhney (2022).

**Prize**: $100 (awarded).

title: Graph
content:
A **simple graph** on vertex set V is Mathlib's `SimpleGraph V`.

Symmetric, irreflexive adjacency relation.

title: Edge Count
content:
**edgeCount(G)** = |E(G)|, the number of edges in the graph.

Computed as the cardinality of the edge finset.

title: Clique
content:
A **clique** is a subset where all pairs are adjacent.

Formally: ∀ u v ∈ S, u ≠ v → G.Adj u v.

title: Independent Set
content:
An **independent set** is a subset where no pairs are adjacent.

Formally: ∀ u v ∈ S, u ≠ v → ¬G.Adj u v.

title: Clique Number ω(G)
content:
**ω(G)** = size of the largest clique.

The supremum over all clique sizes.

title: Independence Number α(G)
content:
**α(G)** = size of the largest independent set.

The supremum over all independent set sizes.

title: Ramsey-Bounded Graph
content:
A graph is **(k, ℓ)-Ramsey-bounded** if ω(G) < k and α(G) < ℓ.

No large clique and no large independent set.

title: ε-Ramsey Graph
content:
A graph is **ε-Ramsey** if ω(G), α(G) < ε log n.

The logarithmic bound is the natural scale for Ramsey-type constraints.

title: Induced Subgraph
content:
The **induced subgraph** on S contains all edges of G between vertices in S.

The natural restriction of G to a subset.

title: Induced Edge Count
content:
**inducedEdgeCount(G, S)** = number of edges in G[S].

The quantity whose range we want to control.

title: Achieves All Edge Counts
content:
**AchievesAllEdgeCounts(G, M)**: G has induced subgraphs with edge counts 0, 1, 2, ..., M.

The key property the conjecture asserts.

title: Edge Count Range Property
content:
**EdgeCountRangeProperty(G, δ)**: G achieves all edge counts up to δn².

The quadratic bound is optimal (Erdős-Szemerédi).

title: Erdős-McKay Conjecture
content:
**Conjecture**: ∀ ε > 0, ∃ δ > 0 such that every ε-Ramsey graph on n vertices achieves all edge counts up to δn².

**Status**: PROVED (KSSS 2022).

title: Weak Erdős-McKay Bound
content:
Erdős and McKay proved the weaker bound: δ(log n)² instead of δn².

The gap from logarithmic to polynomial was the challenge.

title: Erdős-Szemerédi Density
content:
**Erdős-Szemerédi**: ε-Ramsey graphs have Θ(n²) edges.

This makes δn² the natural target - it's the order of magnitude of total edges.

title: Anticoncentration
content:
**Anticoncentration**: a distribution doesn't concentrate on any single value.

Key technique: random induced subgraph edge counts are well-spread.

title: KSSS Theorem
content:
**Kwan-Sah-Sauermann-Sawhney (2022)**:

The Erdős-McKay conjecture is TRUE.

Used anticoncentration to show random subgraphs hit all edge counts.

title: Prize
content:
**$100 Erdős Prize** awarded to KSSS for solving this problem.

One of the notable Erdős problem prizes.

title: The δ Function
content:
**δ(ε)** is the function guaranteed by KSSS.

For each ε > 0, there exists δ(ε) > 0 such that ε-Ramsey graphs achieve all edge counts up to δn².

title: δ(ε) > 0
content:
**Theorem**: δ(ε) > 0 for all ε > 0.

The function is well-defined and positive.

title: Main Result
content:
**Erdős Problem #88: SOLVED**

The Erdős-McKay conjecture is TRUE.

For ε > 0, every ε-Ramsey graph has induced subgraphs with all edge counts up to δn².

**Prize**: $100 (awarded to KSSS 2022).

title: The Answer
content:
**Answer**: YES

The Erdős-McKay conjecture is TRUE (KSSS 2022).
